CatDescriptText: Mr. Sandy (Eugene) Strange, retired plumber's helper, 441 Burrows Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think waitresses should be paid a minimum of $1 per hour plus tips?" answer reads: "Yes. A good waitress is worth every penny of $1 an hour plus tips.  If you don't believe it, go into places where they are underpaid, and see what sloppy service you get."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sandy (Eugene) Strange wearing striped bow tie and sheer light colored collared shirt, standing in front of plywood wall against building with tile front
